newsitem.title: MEXICO: U.S. jeered, Cuba cheered by Mexican militants.
newsitem.headline: U.S. jeered, Cuba cheered by Mexican militants.

text.p: In a revealing display of political loyalties, delegates at the Mexican ruling party's convention jeered and booed U.S. observers on Sunday but cheered the Cuban Communist Party ecstatically.
As the moderator read out a list of "fraternal delegates" from other countries to the Institutional Revolutionary Party's (PRI) National Assembly, rank-and-file militants cheered their greetings.
El Salvador's Farabundo Marti Liberation Front -- a former Marxist guerrilla group -- Nicaragua's Sandinistas, China's Communist Party and even Canada's Parti Quebecois all won applause.
But when PRI delegates heard the U.S. Republican and Democratic parties mentioned, the cheers turned to jeers, catcalls and whistling.
Founded in the aftermath of the 1910-1917 Mexican Revolution, the PRI has traditionally been a bastion of anti-American nationalism.
Although PRI government ministers regularly sit down for friendly talks with their American counterparts, rank-and-file militants retain their traditional suspicion of the "Colossus of the North."
